newsitem.title: USA: U.S. OPTIONS FOCUS/Tame May expiration expected.
newsitem.headline: U.S. OPTIONS FOCUS/Tame May expiration expected.

text.p: Over the last few months, expiration weeks have been the calmest weeks in options cycles, and traders said Wednesday that this expiration week is shaping up similarly.
"I don't know if you'll have any big gains coming off this," Jay Shartsis, head of options trading at R.F. Lafferty & Co in New York, said, referring to expiration-linked gains.
"The OEX (S&P 100 index) will probably go out between 820 and 825," he said.
The OEX was up 4.93 at 823.84 Wednesday afternoon, off its 826.14 session high.
May options expire at the end of the week.
Jerry Hegarty, an analyst at Thomson Financial services, said early euphoria off the weaker than expected April producer price report Tuesday morning drove the OEX to its session high.
But he doubted whether that level would be breached again soon.
"I think the market's starting to hit some resistance overhead," he said. "They're going to hang in there and close around these levels, at least through tomorrow afternoon."
Shartsis said the market's resiliency Tuesday in the face of a sharp selloff in technology bellwether Intel Corp was noteworthy, but it is well overbought.
"It's perhaps bullish that the market was able to contain a rather severe selloff in Intel and some related techs," he said. "The market's intact. It's gone up a great deal.
"A study of highly overbought markets indicates you flatten out for a while then you go up again," he added. "That's probably what's going to happen here."
Turnover in May OEX options continued to be heavy, led by the 820 put, which traded more than 14,300 contracts.
The OEX May 830 call traded about 11,300 contracts. The option, which had open interest of 10,168 through Tuesday, including an addition of 1,638 contracts, was up 1-3/8 at 4-1/4.
Overall OEX call and put volume was about even, with roughly 78,000 puts changing hands compared to 73,000 calls by mid-afternoon.
Put volume in the S&P 500 index .SPX outpaced call volume by 61,000 to 44,000.
